intro: Guatteria caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Marcaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
